page.title: 02MEYSEY HAMPTON VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Meysey Hampton is a small village. We have a shop/post office and a Memorial Hall. Next to the hall is the school and further down the road is St. Mary's Church. Up the road a bit, you come to the green with the pump and a seat to rest on. Across the road there is a playing field and further down there is a nursery school. There are three farms in Meysey Hampton: one owned by Mr Pursch, another by Mr Caroe, and the third by Mr Breton. We have a pub called the Mason's Arms.
